TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants - Mr Blagota Barać , Mr PERSON , Mr PERSON , Mr PERSON , PERSON , Mr PERSON , Mr Ranko Tomašević , Mr PERSON , Mr PERSON , Mr PERSON , Mr PERSON , Mr PERSON , and Mr PERSON - are all LOC nationals who were born in DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE , DATE , and DATE respectively and live in GPE .
CARDINAL . The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants filed a claim for compensation ( isplata zimnice ) against their employer .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( PERSON ) in GPE ruled in their favour , awarding them MONEY ( ORG ) each , plus legal costs totalling ORG CARDINAL .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( PERSON ) in GPE overturned the previous judgment and rejected the ORG claim , relying solely on the Act on Changes and LAW to LAW ( Zakon o izmjenama i dopunama PERSON , hereinafter “ LAW ” ) . At the same time , the applicants were ordered to pay jointly to their employer LAW for legal costs . The applicants received this judgment on DATE at earliest .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( PERSON ) in GPE rejected the ORG appeal on points of law on procedural grounds ( revizija se odbacuje ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( Ustavni sud ) declared LAW unconstitutional ( see paragraph CARDINAL below ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE that decision was published in Official Gazette no . CARDINAL ( NORP list br . CARDINAL ) , and thereby the said LAW ceased to be in force ( see paragraph CARDINAL , in particular LAW therein , and paragraph CARDINAL below ) .
CARDINAL . The relevant provisions of the LAW provided as follows :
“ When it is established that an LAW [ ... ] is not in accordance with LAW [ ... ] that LAW [ ... ] ceases to be in force on DATE when ORG decision is published in ORG . ”

“ [ Such an ] Act [ ... ] can not be applied to matters ( odnosi ) which arose before DATE when the decision of ORG was published unless a final decision in the particular matter was rendered before DATE . ”

“ Those whose rights have been violated by final decisions rendered on the basis of an Act ... which ORG established was not in accordance with LAW ... have the right to request the body in charge to change the final decision [ in question ] .
A request to have [ such a ] decision changed shall be submitted within DATE when the decision of ORG was published in ORG . ”

“ If the consequences of the implementation of the [ unconstitutional ] Act ... can not be removed by having the impugned decision changed , ORG can determine that the consequences be removed by restitutio in integrum , compensation , or in some other way . ”
CARDINAL . The relevant part of the ORG reads as follows :
“ It has been established that LAW ( ORG , no . CARDINAL ) is not in accordance with LAW and it shall cease to exist on DATE when this decision is published .
CARDINAL . The Decision specified that the reason for declaring the above Act unconstitutional was that it had not been adopted in ORG by an absolute majority of MPs , as required by LAW .
CARDINAL . The Decision was published on DATE .

CARDINAL . The Government submitted CARDINAL decisions of ORG , rendered in DATE , DATE and DATE , respectively , on the basis of Articles DATE and CARDINAL of LAW DATE . In all CARDINAL decisions ORG , in rejecting other PERSON requests , had held that Article CARDINAL actually provided for an individual the right to request the reopening of proceedings in which an impugned decision had been rendered .
CARDINAL . In particular , in its decision of DATE ORG had rejected an initiative to assess the constitutionality of LAW .

CARDINAL . In DATE ORG rejected a claimant ’s request to amend a decision rendered by ORG in DATE , which first - instance decision had been based on a provision which was later , in DATE , declared unconstitutional .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE ORG rejected a claimant ’s request to remove the consequences he had allegedly suffered before DATE on account of the implementation of a decision of ORG , the decision having been declared unconstitutional in DATE .

CARDINAL . In the latter CARDINAL decisions , the PERSON requests were rejected as they had failed to previously request the reopening of the proceedings in which the impugned decisions had been rendered .
